Virtual Athenaeum: Do you have a lot of small crayon pieces left over at the end of the school year? Learn how you can recycle old crayons and make them good as new again!

**Be sure to have an adult help with this project!**

All you need to make your own crayon creation is:
old, broken crayons (with the paper removed)

If using the oven:
muffin tin (or silicone baking mold)
muffin tin liners (or non-stick spray)

Bake at about 200 degrees for about 10 min

If using the microwave:
Microwave-safe bowl, dish or mold

Microwave on low heat for approximately 5-6 minutes (stop and stir every 2 minutes)

**Be careful after crayons are melted as they will be very hot. Wait until your crayons are completely cooled before taking them out of the mold and using them. Remember, be sure to have an adult help with this project!**

For more videos or to register for After-School Athenaeum 2020-21, please visit:

post_text: Twelve third through fifth graders at Archway Trivium West competed this morning in our 2019 Bard Competition. In front of all their peers, our scholars displayed incredible courage in reciting their interpretations of Poe, Shakespeare, Whitman and others. Lavender James (4th Grade) emerged as our champion and will represent our school at the Great Hearts Bard competition in the spring. Maya Varshine (5th Grade) and Charlotte Wolfley (5th Grade) were our 2nd and 3rd place winners. Congratulations to all of our scholars for persevering in the art and skill of poetry recitations to honor that which is true, good and beautiful.
